faqs.question: What criteria are used for evaluating hackathon submissions?
faqs.answer: Hackathon submissions are evaluated based on innovation, technical implementation, problem-solving approach, user experience, and presentation quality.

faqs.question: Is there any registration fee for the event?
faqs.answer: No, there is no registration fee for the event. Participation is completely free.

faqs.question: Is there a certificate for participation?
faqs.answer: Yes, all participants will receive certificates for their participation.

faqs.question: What is the criteria for team formation?
faqs.answer: Teams can consist of 2-4 members. Each member must register individually and associate with the same team during registration.

faqs.question: Can we use APIs?
faqs.answer: Yes, you are encouraged to use APIs, provided they comply with the eventâ€™s rules and ethical guidelines.

faqs.question: Can we use PreTrained Models?
faqs.answer: Yes, pre-trained models can be used as long as they align with the project goals and rules of the competition.

faqs.question: What tools or frameworks are allowed?
faqs.answer: You can use any tools or frameworks that help you build and implement your project effectively.

faqs.question: Are there any restrictions on the programming languages we can use?
faqs.answer: No, there are no restrictions. You can use any programming language that suits your project. But python is prefered to be used.

faqs.question: Do team members need to be from the same college?
faqs.answer: Yes, team members have to be from same colleges or institutions.

faqs.question: Can we change team members after registration?
faqs.answer: No, team members cannot be changed after registration. Please ensure that your team is final before registering.

faqs.question: Can we submit a project that has already been developed?
faqs.answer: No, all projects must be developed during the hackathon.

faqs.question: Can we submit a project that has already been submitted to another hackathon?
faqs.answer: No, all projects must be original and developed specifically for this hackathon.

faqs.question: Can we submit a project that has already been published?
faqs.answer: No, all projects must be original and developed specifically for this hackathon.

faqs.question: Can we submit a project that has already been implemented in a startup?
faqs.answer: No, all projects must be original and developed specifically for this hackathon.

faqs.question: Can we submit a project that has already been implemented in a company?
faqs.answer: No, all projects must be original and developed specifically for this hackathon.

faqs.question: Can we submit a project that has already been implemented in a research paper?
faqs.answer: No, all projects must be original and developed specifically for this hackathon.

faqs.question: Can we submit a project that has already been implemented in a thesis?
faqs.answer: No, all projects must be original and developed specifically for this hackathon.

faqs.question: Can we submit a project that has already been implemented in a course?
faqs.answer: No, all projects must be original and developed specifically for this hackathon.

faqs.question: Will there be any mentorship provided?
faqs.answer: Yes, mentors will be available to guide teams during the hackathon.

faqs.question: Will there be workshops or mentoring during the hackathon?
faqs.answer: Yes, workshops and mentoring sessions will be conducted to help participants with their projects.

faqs.question: Can we work on pre-existing projects?
faqs.answer: No, all submissions must be original and developed during the hackathon.

faqs.question: What should the GitHub repository include?
faqs.answer: Your GitHub repository should include the source code, a README file with project details, instructions for running the project, and any relevant documentation.

faqs.question: Can we submit multiple entries?
faqs.answer: No, each team is allowed to submit only one entry.

faqs.question: What is the judging criteria for Neurathon?
faqs.answer: Judging criteria include innovation, feasibility, technical complexity, societal impact, and the presentation of the final solution.
